 Number of vertical line defects that could be corrected.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum vpsissIsif2DLscDownScaleFactor

Enum defining down scaling factor for gain and offset table for 2D LSC.

Enumerator
VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_DS_8 

Down Scaling factor is 8, ie paxel is 8 pixel tall

VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_DS_16 

Down Scaling factor is 16, ie paxel is 16 pixel tall

VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_DS_32 

Down Scaling factor is 32, ie paxel is 32 pixel tall

VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_DS_64 

Down Scaling factor is 64, ie paxel is 64 pixel tall

VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_DS_128 

Down Scaling factor is 128, ie paxel is 128 pixel tall

VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_FORCE_INT 

This will ensure enum is not packed, will always be contained in int

enum vpsissIsif2DLscGainFormat

Enum defining gain format for 2D LSC, 8bit gain can be in various format, based on number of number of bits for int and fraction portion.

Enumerator
VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_GAIN_FORMAT_U8Q8 

All bits are fraction

VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_GAIN_FORMAT_U8Q8_1Base 

All bits are fraction with base of 1.0

VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_GAIN_FORMAT_U8Q7 

In 8bit mode, 7bit fraction

VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_GAIN_FORMAT_U8Q7_1BASE 

In 8bit mode, 7bit fraction with base of 1.0

VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_GAIN_FORMAT_U8Q6 

In 8bit mode, 6bit fraction

VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_GAIN_FORMAT_U8Q6_1BASE 

In 8bit mode, 7bit fraction with base of 1.0

VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_GAIN_FORMAT_U8Q5 

In 8bit mode, 5bit fraction

VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_GAIN_FORMAT_U8Q5_1BASE 

In 8bit mode, 5bit fraction with base of 1.0

VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_GAIN_FORMAT_FORCE_INT 

This will ensure enum is not packed, will always be contained in int

enum vpsissIsif2DLscOffsetShiftup

Enum defining gain format for 2D LSC, 8bit gain can be in various format, based on number of number of bits for int and fraction portion.

Enumerator
VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_OFFSET_SHIFT_0 

No Shifting

VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_OFFSET_SHIFT_1 

1 bit left shift/shift up the offset

VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_OFFSET_SHIFT_2 

2 bit left shift/shift up the offset

VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_OFFSET_SHIFT_3 

3 bit left shift/shift up the offset

VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_OFFSET_SHIFT_4 

4 bit left shift/shift up the offset

VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_OFFSET_SHIFT_5 

5 bit left shift/shift up the offset

VPS_ISS_ISIF_2D_LSC_OFFSET_SHIFT_FORCE_INT 

This will ensure enum is not packed, will always be contained in int

enum vpsissIsifModule

Enum defining supported sub-modules of ISIF.

Enumerator
VPS_ISS_ISIF_MODULE_WB 

Gain and Offset Sub-Module of the ISIF

VPS_ISS_ISIF_MODULE_VDFC 

Vertical Line Defect Pixel correction

VPS_ISS_ISIF_MODULE_BLACK_CLAMP 

Black Clamping module, also used for setting up DC offset

VPS_ISS_ISIF_MODULE_2D_LSC 

2D Lens Shading correction module

VPS_ISS_ISIF_MODULE_FORCE_INT 

This will ensure enum is not packed, will always be contained in int

enum vpsissIsifOutput

Enum defining three outputs from ISIF. Used in enabling/disabling gain offset/white balance for the output.

Enumerator
VPS_ISS_ISIF_OUTPUT_H3A 

H3A Output from ISIF

VPS_ISS_ISIF_OUTPUT_IPIPE 

IPIPE Output from ISIF

VPS_ISS_ISIF_OUTPUT_MEMORY 

Memory Output from ISIF

VPS_ISS_ISIF_MAX_OUTPUT 

should be the last number, used in defining array size

VPS_ISS_ISIF_OUTPUT_FORCE_INT 

This will ensure enum is not packed, will always be contained in int

enum vpsissIsifVfdcMethod

Used to configure the mode of Vertical Line Defect Correction block.

Enumerator
VPS_ISS_ISIF_VDFC_METHOD_2_NON_SATU_PIX 

Method 2 - Saturated pixels - Will passed as received. NON-Saturated pixels - Corrected by subtracting with defined value. Seperate value to be subtracted for pixels that are above defective pixels. Seperate value to be subtracted for pixels that are below defective pixels. All above three values are configureable. Subtraction of pixels that are above defective pixels can be disabled.

VPS_ISS_ISIF_VDFC_METHOD_2_SATU_PIX 

Method 2 - Same as VPS_ISS_ISIF_VDFC_METHOD_2_NON_SATU_PIX with horizontal interpolation for saturated pixels. n-2, n-1, n, n+1, n+2. saturated pixel value = avg ((n-2) + n+2) / 2

VPS_ISS_ISIF_VDFC_METHOD_1_HAVG 

Method 1 - Defective pixel value is replaced by average of 2 pixels. n-2, n-1, n, n+1, n+2. defective pixel value = avg ((n-2) + n+2) / 2

VPS_ISS_ISIF_VDFC_FORCE_INT 

VFDC is disabled This will ensure enum is not packed, will always be contained in int
